alert.note: Alert for Culberson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 8:13PM CDT until June 03 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM MDT/1115 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast New Mexico and southwest Texas, including the following counties, in southeast New Mexico, Eddy. In southwest Texas, Culberson. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM MDT /1115 PM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 713 PM MDT /813 PM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Hay Hollow, Owl Draw, Delaware River, Black River and Red Bluff Draw. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of South Central Eddy and Northeastern Culberson Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
